definitions: To take in or soak up (liquid, gas, or other substance) by chemical or physical action.
To take in and understand fully (information, ideas, or experience).
To reduce the effect of (a force or impact).
To take up the attention of (someone); engross.
To incorporate or assimilate (something) into a larger entity.
examples: The sponge will absorb the water.
She tried to absorb all the new information.
The car's bumper is designed to absorb impact.
The game completely absorbed his attention.
The company plans to absorb its smaller competitor.
